NATIONAL ECONOMY BILL.The attached draft Bill is circulated by direction of the Prime Minister. The Bill has been considered by the Cabinet Committee appointed yesterday (Cabinet 52 (31) Conclusion 1) and the present draft incorporates their amendments.(Signed) M.P*A. HANREY.Secretary, Cabinet.Whitehall Gardens, S0 W,1. September 3rd, 1931. CQNfflDhKTlAL .(.21 & 22 G-SO, 5.). National, Economy .DBA F I1 01'' A BILL TOA.1.1931. Provide lor the making of Orders in Council for the purpose of effecting economies in certain services.Be it enacted by the KingTs most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows : -Power to make Orders in Council for effect-ing economies in certain services.1. During the period of J^one month,/ after the commencement of this Act, His Ma jesty ' may, in respect of the services specified in the Schedule to this Act, make such Orders in Council, notwithstanding anything in any enactments relating to those services, as appear to him to be expedient for the purposes--(a) of reducing the expenditure failing to be defrayed out of the Exchequer or outof any funds established by the enactments relating to any of those serviees;(b) of altering the proportions of the expenditure to te borne respectivelyby or between those funds or any of them or by the Exchequer;(c) of increasing the contributions to be made to the unemployment fund;and any sucn Order may, for the purposes aforesaid, provide for the modification or termination of any agreement entered into for the purposes of any of the said services.(2)/ Any Order in Council made under this section with respect to any service may empower a Secretary of State or any Minister specified in the Order as being the Minister responsible for that service, to make regulations for giving effect to the provisions of the Order. (3'ii Any Order in Council made under this section and any regulation made under any such Order shall have effect as irom such date net earlier than the first day of October, nineteen hundred and thirty-one as may be specified in-the Order or regulation.2. This Act may be cited as the National Economy Act, 1931. SCHEDULEA, D.SERVICES IN RESPECT OP WHICH ORDERS IN COUNCIL MAY BE MADE UNDER THIS ACT.Education.National Health.
